alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Sawyer (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 12:10AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Bayfield, southwestern Ashland and north central Sawyer Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1210 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chippewa Flowage East, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Clam Lake around 1225 AM CDT. Mellen around 1240 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Chief Lake, Morse, Ghost Lake, High Bridge, Lost Land Lake, Moose Lake Sawyer County, Chippewa Lake, Teal Lake, Day Lake and Copper Falls State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
